intro: Hydrophyllum virginicum, commonly known as narrowleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall. Hydrophyllum virginicum is an important plant for pollinators and is often found in native plant gardens.
